00034   const int64_t TIMESTAMP_MIN  = INT64_MIN;
00035   const int64_t TIMESTAMP_MAX  = INT64_MAX;
00036   const int64_t TIMESTAMP_NULL = INT64_MIN + 1;
00037   const int64_t TIMESTAMP_AUTO = INT64_MIN + 2;
00038   const int64_t AUTO_ASSIGN    = INT64_MIN + 2;
00039 
00040   class KeySpec {
00041   public:
00042 
00043     KeySpec() : row(0), row_len(0), column_family(0), column_qualifier(0),
00044                 column_qualifier_len(0), timestamp(AUTO_ASSIGN),
00045                 revision(AUTO_ASSIGN) {}
00046 
00047     explicit KeySpec(const char *r, const char *cf, const char *cq,
00048                      int64_t ts = AUTO_ASSIGN)
00049       : row(r), row_len(r ? strlen(r) : 0), column_family(cf),
00050         column_qualifier(cq), column_qualifier_len(cq ? strlen(cq) : 0),
00051         timestamp(ts), revision(AUTO_ASSIGN) {}
00052 
00053     explicit KeySpec(const char *r, const char *cf,
00054                      int64_t ts = AUTO_ASSIGN)
00055       : row(r), row_len(r ? strlen(r) : 0), column_family(cf),
00056         column_qualifier(0), column_qualifier_len(0),
00057         timestamp(ts), revision(AUTO_ASSIGN) {}
00058 
00059     void clear() {
00060       row = 0;
00061       row_len = 0;
00062       column_family = 0;
00063       column_qualifier = 0;
00064       column_qualifier_len = 0;
00065       timestamp = AUTO_ASSIGN;
00066       revision = AUTO_ASSIGN;
00067     }
00068 
00069     void sanity_check() const {
00070       const char *r = (const char *)row;
00071       const char *cq = (const char *)column_qualifier;
00072 
00073       // Sanity check the row key
00074       if (row_len == 0)
00075         HT_THROW(Error::BAD_KEY, "Invalid row key - cannot be zero length");
00076 
00077       if (r[row_len] != 0)
00078         HT_THROW(Error::BAD_KEY,
00079                  "Invalid row key - must be followed by a '\\0' character");
00080 
00081       if (strlen(r) != row_len)
00082         HT_THROWF(Error::BAD_KEY, "Invalid row key - '\\0' character not "
00083                  "allowed (offset=%d)", (int)strlen(r));
00084 
00085       if (r[0] == (char)0xff && r[1] == (char)0xff)
00086         HT_THROW(Error::BAD_KEY, "Invalid row key - cannot start with "
00087                  "character sequence 0xff 0xff");
00088 
00089       // Sanity check the column qualifier
00090       if (column_qualifier_len > 0) {
00091         if (cq[column_qualifier_len] != 0)
00092           HT_THROW(Error::BAD_KEY, "Invalid column qualifier - must be followed"
00093                    " by a '\\0' character");
00094         if (strlen(cq) != column_qualifier_len)
00095           HT_THROWF(Error::BAD_KEY, "Invalid column qualifier - '\\0' character"
00096                     " not allowed (offset=%d)", (int)strlen(cq));
00097       }
00098     }
00099 
00100     const void  *row;
00101     size_t       row_len;
00102     const char  *column_family;
00103     const char  *column_qualifier;
00104     size_t       column_qualifier_len;
00105     int64_t      timestamp;
00106     int64_t      revision;  // internal use only
00107   };
00108 
00109   std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &, const KeySpec &);

00116   class KeySpecBuilder : boost::noncopyable {
00117   public:
00118     void set_row(const String &row) {
00119       m_strings.push_back(row);
00120       m_key_spec.row = m_strings.back().c_str();
00121       m_key_spec.row_len = m_strings.back().length();
00122     }
00123 
00124     void set_column_family(const String &cf) {
00125       m_strings.push_back(cf);
00126       m_key_spec.column_family = m_strings.back().c_str();
00127     }
00128 
00129     void set_column_qualifier(const String &cq) {
00130       m_strings.push_back(cq);
00131       m_key_spec.column_qualifier = m_strings.back().c_str();
00132       m_key_spec.column_qualifier_len = m_strings.back().length();
00133     }
00134 
00135     void set_timestamp(int64_t timestamp) {
00136       m_key_spec.timestamp = timestamp;
00137     }
00138 
00142     void clear() {
00143       m_key_spec.clear();
00144       m_strings.clear();
00145     }
00146 
00152     KeySpec &get() { return m_key_spec; }
00153 
00154   private:
00155     std::vector<String> m_strings;
00156     KeySpec m_key_spec;
00157   };
